title: IMF Chief commends ongoing economic stabilization efforts
byline: Visiting Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Kristalina Georgieva has held discussions with Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya in Colombo.

title: Heavy rainfall above 75 mm expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Central, Uva, Eastern and Southern provinces.

title: Several Arab, Islamic countries welcome holy month of Ramadan
byline: Several Arab and Islamic countries will welcome the holy month of Ramadan today, while others will start fasting a day later.

title: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake to be produced in court today
byline: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake is scheduled to be produced in court once again today (18).

title: Sri Lanka can achieve higher growth if necessary structural reforms take place: IMF Chief
byline: Dr. Kristalina Georgieva, the Managing Director (MD) of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), visited the Central Bank of Sri Lanka on 17 February 2026 during her visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Peru’s Congress removes President Jose Jeri after 4 months in office
byline: Peru’s Congress voted on Tuesday to censure the country’s interim president, effectively ending the brief tenure of Jose Jeri after just over four months in office.

title: GMOA raises alarm over public and professional safety after lawyer’s murder
byline: The brutal shooting and killing of a lawyer and his wife has once again raised serious concerns regarding the safety of citizens and professionals in the country, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) stated.

title: Iran says ‘guiding principles’ agreed with US at nuclear talks
byline: Iran has said it has reached an understanding with the US on the main “guiding principles” to resolve their dispute over Tehran’s nuclear programme.

title: Bad Bunny makes history with new career milestone
byline: Bad Bunny continues to leap to new heights.

title: YouTube down in USA: Tens of thousands of users face problems amid outage
byline: Alphabet-owned tab YouTube was down for more than 320,000 users in the United States on Tuesday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.

title: Woman killed, child injured in Mahiyanganaya bus accident
byline: A woman has been killed while a child sustained injuries in a road accident that occurred near the 48th milepost on the Mahiyanganaya– Diyatalawa road, police stated.

title: YouTube restored after suffering outage for two hours
byline: YouTube experienced an access outage starting at around 6:30 a.m. today, with all functions restored by around 08:30 a.m.

title: Upali Pannilage named in committee probing controversial release of 323 containers
byline: Minister Dr. Upali Pannilage has been appointed as a member of the Parliamentary Select Committee tasked with investigating the release of 323 containers without proper physical inspection.

title: Govt. to obtain US$50 million from World Bank for Digital Transformation Project
byline: The government has decided to obtain the Special Drawing Rights (SDR) fund equal to US$ 50 million from the World Bank Group to implement the Sri Lanka Digital Transformation Project.

title: Christians to observe Ash Wednesday as Lent begins
byline: Christians across the world are preparing for Lent through prayer, fasting and community service as the 40-day period of reflection approaches.

title: Adani Group to invest $100 billion in renewable-powered AI data centres by 2035
byline: India’s Adani Group said on Monday it will invest $100 billion by 2035 to build renewable-energy-powered data centres designed for Artificial Intelligence (AI) workloads, marking one of the country’s largest private commitments to digital infrastructure.

title: Akuregoda murder suspects deleted phone data after shooting – Police
byline: The suspects arrested in connection with the Akuregoda double murder had deleted data from their mobile phones following the crime, police stated.

title: President holds talks with US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor in Delhi
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met US President Donald Trump’s Special Representative for South and Central Asia and US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor in Delhi this morning (18).

title: Water supply to several areas in Colombo disrupted due to pipeline breakdown
byline: Water supply to several areas in and around Colombo has been disrupted today following a sudden breakdown in the main transmission pipeline from Ambatale to Dehiwala, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board has announced.

title: Vatican says it will not participate in Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’
byline: The Vatican will not participate in U.S. President Donald Trump’s so-called “Board of Peace” initiative, Cardinal Pietro Parolin, the Vatican’s top diplomatic official, said on Tuesday while adding that efforts to handle crisis situations should be managed by the United Nations.

title: French President praises India’s growing global influence in innovation
byline: French President Emmanuel Macron praised India’s growing global influence in innovation, highlighting Indian-origin CEOs leading major multinational companies from IBM to Microsoft at the India–France Innovation Forum in Mumbai.

title: US says it ‘supports’ UK Chagos Islands deal
byline: The US government has given its official backing to the UK’s plan to hand over the Chagos Islands to Mauritius and lease back an important military base.

title: Low pressure system persists in Bay of Bengal; 128 mm rainfall in Batticaloa
byline: The highest rainfall of 128.9 mm was recorded from Batticaloa yesterday (17), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Maithree Wickremesinghe notified to appear before FCID on Feb. 20
byline: Maithree Wickremesinghe, the wife of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, has been notified to appear before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) on February 20.

title: Takaichi reelected as Japan’s prime minister with a goal of pushing to the right
byline: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi was reappointed Wednesday by Parliament to form her second Cabinet, following last week’s landslide election win that she hopes will allow a hard-right move to the country’s policies. All previous ministers are expected to be retained.

title: Saman Ekanayake granted bail
byline: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake has been granted bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Weather advisory issued for heavy rainfall in several areas
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for heavy rain in the Uva Province and Polonnaruwa, Batticaloa, Ampara, Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: Two brothers arrested over Akuregoda double murder remanded
byline: The two brothers arrested in connection with the shooting and killing of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda have been remanded until March 04 by the Kaduwela Magistrate’s Court today (18).

title: Quasi judge arrested over Rs. 5,000 bribery allegation
byline: A Quasi Judge attached to the Koralaipattu (Central) Quasi Court in Valaichchenai has been arrested on allegations of accepting a bribe of Rs. 5,000.

title: Indian university kicked out of AI summit for claiming Chinese robot dog as its own invention
byline: An Indian university has been asked to vacate its stall at the country’s flagship AI summit after a staff member was caught presenting a commercially available robotic dog made in China as its own creation, two government sources said.

title: Sri Lankan Muslims to begin Ramadan fasting tomorrow
byline: Muslims in Sri Lanka will begin their Ramadan fasting at dawn on Thursday (19), after the crescent for the month of Ramadan was sighted in the country, this evening (18), the Colombo Grand Mosque confirmed.

title: Twelve killed in China’s Hubei as firecracker store explosion triggers blaze
byline: Twelve people were killed on Wednesday when a store selling firecrackers exploded and caught fire in China’s Hubei province, burning 50 square metres of the premises, state broadcaster CCTV reported.

title: Advisory for low-pressure area to the south-east of Sri Lanka
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber‘advisory for multi-day boats fishermen and naval community regarding the low-pressure area in the Southwest Bay of Bengal to the south-east of Sri Lanka.

title: Fishing licenses of local vessels deliberately disabling VMS to be suspended?
byline: A high-level meeting on combating illegal fishing activities was convened at the Parliament Complex, according to the Ministry of Defence.

title: Ex-Dy Secretary General of Parliament files writ petition seeking to nullify interdiction
byline: Former Deputy Secretary General of Parliament, Chaminda Kularatne, has filed a writ petition before the Court of Appeal, seeking to nullify the decision to interdict him from duty without a fair inquiry, a reporter said.

title: Five arrested for posting video insulting the President on social media
byline: Five individuals have been arrested by Katana Police for allegedly directing verbal abuse towards President Anura Kumara Dissanayake near the Southern Expressway entry point in Mattala and subsequently posting the video on social media.

title: Inaugural Sri Lanka-Belgium Political Consultations emphasise strengthening bilateral relations
byline: The inaugural round of Sri Lanka-Belgium Political Consultations was successfully held in Brussels, marking an important milestone in the longstanding relationship between the two countries.

title: Chairperson of Lanka Sugar Company resigns citing friction with provincial politicians
byline: The Chairperson of Lanka Sugar Company (Pvt) Ltd, Sandamali Chandrasekera, has resigned from her post with immediate effect citing pressure from certain local politicians.
